citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
During the Fall 2023 semi-annual inspection, IACUC members reviewed the water restriction log for gerbils used for Study
Protocol CGL. Two separate incidents were identified in which water for gerbils 568, 569, and 570 was restricted for
longer than the maximum time allowed in the protocol. The gerbils received water at the following intervals:
- October 6, 2024 at 13:30 hours (1:30pm) and October 8, 2024 at 17:00 hours (5:00pm)
- October 12, 2024 at 14:40 hours (2:30pm) and October 14, 2024 at 19:00 hours (7:00pm)
The protocol indicates that water may be restricted for a maximum of 48 hours. Water was restricted from the gerbils for
51.5 hours and 52.5 hours respectively. None of the animals appeared to be negatively affected.
Proposed activities and proposed significant changes in ongoing activities that have been approved by the IACUC may be
subject to further appropriate review and approval by officials of the research facility. Guidelines for the restriction of water
must be followed as outlined in the IACUC approved protocol.
Correction: Appropriate corrective action was taken that included termination of the responsible lab member and
reminding all other lab personnel of the importance of conducting study procedures as indicated in the protocol.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
